newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CRICKET-MULDER BOOKS SHIELD FINAL BERTH FOR WESTERN AUSTRALIA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-MULDER BOOKS SHIELD FINAL BERTH FOR WESTERN AUSTRALIA.

text.p: Western Australia will contest the Sheffield Shield final later this month after they crushed New South Wales by nine wickets inside two days at the WACA Ground on Saturday.
Off-spinner Bret Mulder paved the way for the victory by taking six for 65 to complete an 11-wicket match haul in Perth.
Western Australia moved 12 points clear at the top of the Shield table but the identity of their opponents remains uncertain.

After routing New South Wales for 89 in their first innings, the home side scored 228 in reply before dismissing their opponents for 217. Western Australia cruised to 80 for one to clinch the victory.

Their nearest rivals, Tasmania, who have 24 points, improved their hopes of playing in the final, involving the top two teams at the end of the regular season, by dominating their home match against Queensland.
At close of play on the second day at Bellerive Oval in Hobart, Queensland were 215 for five in reply to Tasmania's first innings 408 all out.
Queensland and New South Wales are locked together in third place on the table on 22 points.
In Adelaide, South Australia were 162 for two in their second innings at close of play on day two against Victoria.
South Australia scored 216 in their first innings before Victoria replied with 241.
